node.text:
Making a difference and “brightening someone’s day” has always been on the top of my bucket list and what inspires my work every day.

In celebration of essie’s 40th birthday, I want to help you check this off your bucket list with #essie #eternaloptimist. 

I have created some art, using some of my favorite essie shades, for you to share with your friends and family to help brighten their day. Head over to @essie to see it! #essiepartner

node.text:
If you’ve ever been to a waterfall or heard the sound of one, it is likely that in one way or another, the waterfall caused you to stop in your tracks. Waterfalls are known around the world for their serene, peaceful beauty.

Every time I’ve personally been to a waterfall, just standing there and taking it all in is more than enough.

But every time I’ve had moments like this, this has come from the sidelines of the waterfall. Either looking down or looking up to the water falling, I’m not necessarily in danger, as a bystander, taking it all in.

Since I spend most of my life outside of the water, it’s easy to forget all that had to take place for this waterfall to be…the river flowing over hard rock and then soft rock that erodes in order for the waterfall to even exist. And it’s this gradual process of erosion that creates the waterfalls we see today.*

I do not know what the rocks and the water feel as they go through this process, but I do know this: in fact, a process…one that can be difficult to fully grasp when standing along the edges.

I think this can also true in other areas of life. When we arrive at some peaceful place, some peaceful moment…we can forget all it took to get there. We can forget all that the rivers carved and the rocks eroded into shape so we could enjoy this beautiful, peaceful wonder.

May we never forget
all it takes
for any beautiful
peaceful moment
to fall into place.
May we never forget
that even if it’s nothing more
than a deep breath,
a short rest,
or a brief quiet moment of a long day,
it took a lot to get here.
May we remain ever grateful
for all it took to be here.

MHN

*Source: Waterfall (Wikipedia)

node.text: This is an excerpt of today's podcast: "When You're Worried About The Future: 7 Phrases To Repeat To Yourself." node.text:
I am sitting here today reading @christineyisuh ‘s posts (who I recommend following), because yesterday’s events in Atlanta are a painful reminder of the lack of change and justice — what happened yesterday breaks my heart and makes me angry. 

This uphill battle involves too big of a hill — the grief, weariness, and exhaustion from being gaslighted and not even being believed that your experiences are even real—it takes a toll on the body. The heart. The soul. It takes a toll on the community. 

We must listen to the stories and accounts of anti-Asian violence and racism. We must fight for justice. And to those on the receiving end of this racism, I just want you to know you are free to feel and you are worthy of spaces where your anger, grief, frustration, and outcries are not gaslighted and rejected...you are allowed to be angry or weary or exhausted of having to communicate, explain, and wait for change. No matter the ones who try to downplay the need for justice, you are worthy of support.

node.title: when you are weary waiting for change

node.text:
Transcript:
“you do not have to know
the names
of every tree
to see their individual,
yet collective beauty.
you can see how
they fit into the landscape
whether they offer shade
or whether they
bear flowers or fruit,
there is room
for trees
of all kinds
to grow
around you.
I wonder
what a difference it could make
if we saw beauty
in each other in the same way.
If we recognized that
no matter our age,
or our shape,
there was room
for each of us
to spring up from our roots
how we were meant to.
for there is an endless depth
to me and you,
that goes beyond what we see.
beyond the shade or size of our leaves,
beyond the color and texture of our bark,
this landscape
supports growth
right here
where you are.
some deciduous,
and others evergreen,
through every season
in the Light
every single tree
is seen.”
MHN

node.text:
take heart,
breathe deep, 
especially when
you have to say goodbye
before you were ready.
this will not be easy
and this you already know.
you are slowly moving through this.
you feel it in your bones.
and even here,
you free
to breathe and simply breathe.
feel what you need to feel.
and let every moment be
what it needs to be.

III

I think this
is the kind
of goodbye
that you don’t say out loud.
I might not find the words
until a few years from now.

I carry memories
like watercolor
running wild in my mind.
Some things  were meant to flow,
blues and yellows
you learn to let them go.

MHN

About this piece:
This is a piece written for anyone who has had to say goodbye before they were ready. Whether it was something beautiful that you never imagined going away, or something that would end in only a matter of time…I just hope you know it is okay to pace yourself through the spectrum of emotions that come along with that. This piece doesn’t end with a call-to-action resolve for a reason…I just wanted to create space for those feelings.

node.title: If you have to say goodbye before you're ready:

node.text: Here’s a little reminder to pull out the crayons, just because ♥️ I felt a little restless and overwhelmed and pulled out the crayons. I sat here with my little one and we just colored. No coloring books, no plans. Just coloring, just because.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on September 02, 2021. May be an illustration of text that says 'FOR THE OVERWHELMED'.

node.text:
For the overwhelmed:
 This life will ask a lot of you.
And this is also true:
Even when you have a thousand things to do,
it is absolutely okay to crave
a slower pace.
It is absolutely okay
if your energy levels
are not where they were yesterday.
You are allowed to change.
You are allowed to pace yourself here.
You are allowed to ebb and flow,
no matter what is still unknown.

Rise up with the sun.
Settle down with the moon,
Let the natural rhythms of the day
reminder you
to
p a c e
y o u r s e l f
through this.

MHN

node.text:
This month,
Remember that joy is more
than just "staying positive."
Joy is a way of living.
A way of looking for Light in the midst of it all.
Joy is transformational and contagious.
Joy can be shared through action.

This month,
Even if it’s in a small way,
find freedom in letting go.
Dare to trust there is room for courage, surrender, and change,
no matter what is still unknown.

This month,
Be generous with the wisdom
you’ve gathered. Share the lessons you’ve learned. Not as a lecture, but as a gift. Let this be the moment where generosity becomes a practice, a way of life.

This month,
You are free to set new boundaries.
You are free to worry less about what others think of you.

This month,
Be still and pay attention to the way your heart still beats. Notice how you have managed to keep going and growing, no matter what was missing.
- @morganharpernichols

node.text:
When you start to see beautiful things happening for others, and you wonder when those things will ever happen for you, may you know it is okay to not have those things yet while still believing that you are worthy of a beautiful, intentional life too. 
And your life might look a little differently than theirs, and things may not fall in place on the storyline in the way you thought they would, but there will still be beautiful things, and there will still be something good that your weary, waiting heart can still look forward to. 
So breathe deep right where you are, knowing no matter how long this journey has been, you are still traveling, wrapped in grace, and you have not yet reached the end.

MHN

node.text:
You are a human being worthy of love, right here as you are. Even when you don't feel like you're worthy of a break from work, rest, and you're still feeling that pressure to be some version of perfect, you're allowed to push against that in the best way you know.

You're allowed to rebelliously choose to take care of yourself, even when you feel like you should be doing something else.

Your body is worthy of gentleness even when you do not feel satisfied with the skin you are in.

Your heart is worthy of love even when you have been rejected by the one you’ve loved. 

Your hard work matters even in the middle of the project.

Your uniqueness is worth accepting even when you don’t quite fit into the “in-crowd.”

Your mind is worthy of a break even when you have a long list of things to do.

You are worthy of experiencing a life of love, peace, and joy, right here in your in-betweens.

Be kind to yourself,
right here where you are,
for you are more than your failures,
your losses, your worries, your scars.

MHN

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on August 27, 2021. May be an image of flower and text that says 'LIGHT WILL MEET YOU THE PATH ON'.

node.text:
Here in this life you will feel many things. You will laugh and you will let go. You will gather stories, and you will grieve. You will be interrupted by Light. You will find gold in little things.  You will have questions that lead to answers and you will have questions you sit with for years… you will long for days to come, and you will learn to find joy right here. You will watch old things drift away and you will see new things take shape. You will look back on old years in awe of the ways you’ve changed.  And over and over, things will change and you might feel a little afraid… and you will also find there is grace to take this day by day. Take heart, here in the change. You’ll still bloom, day by day.

May the extra hour of sleep remind you are worthy of rest. May the text from a friend you haven’t heard from in a while remind you: someone does care. May the well-worn sweatpants you put on today remind you of how you have taken care of your things in a mindful way.

May the scent that ignited a positive memory remind you that even in the most difficult things, you still managed to keep that beautiful moment with you. May the breath that leaves your body remind you how even here, amidst all you are holding, you are capable of release. May the sight of the ever-moving clock remind you that tomorrow is on its way, and even though it is unknown, you do not have to be afraid.

Light will meet you on the path. Hope will last. Joy is right here.

MHN

node.text: 5 Words To Keep In Your Vocabulary Even When You’re Facing Unknowns✨

clips_music_attribution_info.should_mute_audio_reason: Instagram music isn't available in your region.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on August 25, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'make room inthe day play ΜΗΝ for'.

node.text:
As we get older and life seems to become about what we can produce, it can be hard to really loosen up and allow ourselves to be in the moment and just play. Even when we do have a moment to play as adults, we might feel a rush of guilt for not working or not doing something more productive. But play is not about a product.

"Play" is an action.

Play is the act of learning to practice joy in a particular moment, even when life is at its most ordinary and mundane.

I collaborated with @darling to create a special deck of playing cards that will help you create more space for play, connection with others, and self-reflection.

Each card includes a conversation starter on the front so you can play cards AND have funny, reflective and deep conversations at the same time.

Cards available in @darling ‘s shop and linked on my IG Story @morganharpernichols !

Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on August 25, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'through itall you are still here today 'and you a're learning to carry on in bedutiful honest ΜΗΝ way'.
Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on August 24, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'HERE'S TO LOVING MAKES WHAT YouYOU YOU You'.

node.text:
It is possible to find a life worth living in the present, even when you are longing for something more. It is possible to get to know yourself in a new way. To realize that even though there are so many things you’re not, there are so many things you are.

You may not be the most social,
but you are a great listener.

You may not be an introvert like your friends,
but you have an amazing sense of humor that brings life to every conversation.

You may not be artistic,
but you still have great ideas that matter.

You may not be famous,
but you have influence in the lives of those who are younger than you.

You may not have met the love of your life yet,
but you still have the capacity to love and be loved.

You may not feel confident,
but you are still beautiful and unique in your own way, even when it goes unnoticed.

You may not be like them,
but you are you.

Yes, there are so many things you are not, but there are also so many things you are.

So here’s to loving what makes you different.

Here’s to loving what makes you you.

MHN

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on August 24, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'HERE'S TO LOVING MAKES WHAT YouYOU YOU You'.
Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on August 24, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Yes, there are so many things you are not, but there are also so many things you are. ΜΗΝ'.
Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on August 23, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text.

node.text:
Just in case no one has told you lately, you are not taking up too much space.

You might be too much for some, but those people will not determine who you will become.

Please do not let powerful people make you feel small.

There will be critics and cynics but I hope they do not silence you because you were meant to use your voice even if it takes years to find the courage. Let this be your bold, honest choice. It is not too late for you to unlearn the lies that tried to define you. It’s not too late to acknowledge and make room to heal from those conversations from long ago. It doesn’t make you weak if it still bothers you. There is still time to work through it, with grace.

Yes, there is such a thing as constructive criticism, and this is also true: a lot of the noise you’re hearing is stemming from someone’s insecurities and fears. It has nothing to do with you.

And it does not make you weak to say, “yes, I have been hurt by their words,” because no matter how much you took their words to heart, it does not determine your worth. It might take years to figure out how to tell your story, where to use your voice, and what it looks like for you to be yourself in this world, but I promise you, it’s worth the journey.

You may not be perfect or enough for everyone, but there is still room for you to be who you were meant to be, unapologetically. You were meant to shine the Light that is still burning within you, from the time you were born.

You were made to come forth, through the fire, like gold, in bold, honest ways.

And remember, the greatness that runs within you can be subtle. It isn’t only found under spotlights or a stage; it is woven into the layers of our very being, no matter your story, your journey, your age.

You do not
have to be perfect to be whole,
bold, radiant soul:
wrapped in grace,
you are free
to be who you were meant to be
no matter what others say or think.

MHN

This is an excerpt from this week's series 'Letting Go and Making Space' in my app @thestorytellerco! Do you have the app yet? I hope you can join us! Available for Apple and Android.

Painted post cards with encouraging text.

node.text:
And so it has begun! Making art in my garage and sending it your way. First 4 I’ve sent out are going to Georgia (2 of them), Ohio, and Wisconsin. I got a lot of submissions and I will be working on this forever - which I am so excited about!!! If you’d like to receive something from my #artinthemailproject the link is in my bio @morganharpernichols. It’s ongoing, and I’ll be randomly selecting :)

Also! International / non-US is totally welcome! I send everywhere 🌍
